snippet: The first of the 10,000 bicycles for the public to rent in a new program in New York City are to to be available starting in late July.
abstract: Citigroup is paying $41 million to be the lead sponsor of New York City's bike-sharing program for five years and to have its name put on the 10,000 bikes; the first bikes are scheduled to reach the streets in parts of Manhattan and Brooklyn at the end of July.
lead_paragraph: The first of the 10,000 bicycles for the public to rent in a new program in New York City are to to be available starting in late July.

headline.seo: New York Cycle Sharing Gets a Name: Citi Bike
headline.main: Citibank Pays to Put Name on Shared Bikes
headline.print_headline: Bank Pays to Put Its ‘Citi’ on Shared Bikes
